meanings.sent1: The little dog outbarked the big dog at the park.
meanings.sent2: The neighbor's dog outbarked all the other dogs in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The tiny chihuahua outbarked the huge mastiff, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The enthusiastic beagle outbarked the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The determined terrier outbarked the thunderstorm, protecting its territory.

meanings.definition: To bark louder or more frequently than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: During the storm, the scared puppy outbarked all the other dogs in the shelter.
meanings.sent2: The excited puppy outbarked its siblings during playtime.
meanings.sent3: The little dog outbarked the doorbell, thinking it was a new friend.
meanings.sent4: The old hound outbarked the young pups, showing he still had some energy left.
meanings.sent5: The persistent poodle outbarked the vacuum cleaner, trying to protect its family.
